Posts.Content: Hi Lois Although this is not much help to you as I am not on tamoxophin, I thought I would write back as I know what you are going through. I was on Arimidex for almost 2 years and the oncologist has just taken me off it as the side effects have now got so bad that I just can't sleep at night for excrutiating pains in my knee joints and hips as well as down the leg bones. He has now put me on Aromasin, which I read all about on the internet. He said it is also a good drug, as well as Femara and Tamoxophin. They are all aromatase inhibitors and all work much the same but some give certain people side effects. He said that I may or may not get side effects with Aromasin. I am willing to give it a try, I have nothing to lose. My advice to you is try Tamoxophin, you might have less side effects, I am giving it a try anyway. I would like to keep in touch with you to see how you are doing in a month or so. I will also post a message to let you know how I am getting on. Good luck with what you intend doing. Regards Ros.
Posts.Title: Tamoxophin

Posts.Content: Hi Denise Thanks for the advice on side effects of bone and joint pain. I read all the messages of May and June and found interesting info. My pains are definitely getting worse as each month goes by. I wake up feeling 30 years older than I am with pains pretty much all over the bones and joints from the hips down! I am not sure whether to stay on this drug as I fear I will be a gnarled old woman before the year is out - but on the other hand I do not want to get reoccuring cancer! I do manage to get out of bed and go on the health walker every morning and once I have done 10 minutes I feel more human. I get depression too, very bad at times. Not sure if this because I lack sleep due to painful nights, feeling sorry for myself or the effects of Arimidex - gosh I do sound a state! I just HAVE to hang on to my sense of humour, otherwise I think I will lose it completely! Anyway I am going to my oncologist for my next check up on Monday and will be asking him about Zometa treatment, although I did look up on the internet and it seems that it is for bone cancer. I hope things go well for you in the future. Take care Ros.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: Hi Mary, thanks for replying regarding the side effects of Arimidex. It seems as if mine and your side effects are very similar but I am not giving in to the drug, I am going to persevere with it even though I get some really bad nights of aching and days of tiredness. My daughter's best friend has just lost her battle against breast cancer, she preferred not to take any drugs, deciding on the herbal route with meditation etc., she was just 39 years old. I have decided to do whatever the oncologist recommends is the best thing for me, which is Arimidex. I have my 6 month check up in a couple of weeks time and that will be 2 years after my mastectomy. I didn't have to have any chemotherapy or radiation as they caught my cancer before it went farther than the lymph nodes so I know that all the side effects are caused by the drug. There is also no back problems in my family, but nor where there any cases of breast cancer! I am going to stick out the drug as long as I can manage to take it, fear of breast cancer coming back outweighs the bone and joint aching! Good luck to you in the future.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: Hi Mary Just been looking back on the site and saw your message 4/3/2005. I just wondered how you are doing as it is now Sept? I have been on Arimidex for almost 2 years and am getting very bad aches and pains in the lower hips, back region, the bones of the legs, fingers, hands, knees. I wake up so stiff and can hardly get out of bed in the morning - feel like I have aged 30 years over the last 2 years! I do go on the health walker for 10 minutes which really helps me first thing in the morning. My worry is that it is going to get worse and as you have been on it longer than me I wonder if you are getting more pains as the time goes on. When I first started with Arimidex I hardly had any side effects for about 6 months and now gradually, each month, the pains seem to worsen. I am going to see the oncologist on Monday as it is my 6 month check and everyone on this site seems to say that I must ask to go on Aromosin or Femara. Have you changed from Arimidex at all? I also want to come off the drug but I am scared in case the breast cancer comes back. I hope you see this and reply to it and hope you are making good progress.
Posts.Title: Arimidex

Posts.Content: I'm new to this website, but came across your question. I have been taking Arimidex for almost 2 years. I was diagnosed with breast cancer in October 2003, and had a mastectomy in November 2003. I knew nothing of breast cancer, so went on the Internet to find out all about treatments etc. I saw that there was a new drug on the market called Arimidex that had just been passed in USA as a much better drug that Tamoxifen. Research did a survey with around 500 ladies on Tamoxifen and the same amount of ladies on the Arimidex. The reoccuring cancer was far higher in the Tamoxifen takers, therefore they had to stop the research as all the ladies on Tamoxifen wanted to go onto the Arimidex. I approached my oncologist in Johannesburg and he said it had only just gone on the market here and didn't think the medical aid would put me on it as it was such a new drug, also the fact that it is about 3 times more expensive than Tamoxifen so medical aids aren't too keen to pay for it. Anyway, they did put me on it and I had hardly any side effects from it to begin with. Now after 2 years I am getting pains in my joints and down my bones in my legs, mainly while I am trying to sleep. I do get very tired easily now and have nowhere near the energy I used to have before I had cancer. I find that my pains down my chest, shoulder and arm are more severe at times too. I am sure it is all brought on from the drug as I did not have to have chemotherapy or radiation as they caught my cancer in the early stages. I did however have around 20 lymph nodes removed which has caused no end of discomfort and does not seem to get better as the months go by. I must admit though, with all the side effects I will still carry on taking the drug as I feel as if it is a sure defence of getting the cancer back. I hope I have been of some help to you. I know what it is like when you want so much to get advice from someone who has been through it. I am in the process of becoming a breast cancer conselor in Johannesburg as there are so many people who do not know which way to turn once they are told they have breast cancer. Go well.
Posts.Title: Has Anybody Taken Arimidex?

Posts.Content: Hi Chris The oncologist changed me from Arimidex to Aromasin in November 2005, so have been on it for 5 months now (previously I was on Arimidex for 2 years). At first the pains in the joints and bones was just as bad, but I think that was the Arimidex still in my body. Now I don't get the bone pain at night so much but I am getting extremely fatigued and want to sleep all the time. I find I am very depressed most of the time as well! You just don't seem to be able to get one with no side affects do you? But I am persevering on this one at the moment as I am sleeping a bit better without waking up with pain spasms. I still have to go another 20 months before I can stop taking them. I hope you get on better with Femara. Regards Roz.
Posts.Title: Arimidex

Posts.Content: Hi Lori I posted a message on the boards a few days ago; Has Anyone Been on Aromasin and Are They Getting Side Effects? and I have just noticed your message. Gosh, now I don't know if I am doing the right thing changing from Arimidex to Aromasin as it looks as if I will still have dreadful side effects. I think you must be getting Arimidex as that is the 3rd aromatase inhibitor. I have had quite a few replies to my message so it might be worth reading for you. I just don't know which way to turn at the moment but I have to start taking Aromasin next month. I was fine on Arimidex for the first 6 months and gradually started getting side effects which have become unbearable.I try to avoid pain killers as my Mother died of a stroke quite early in life and I feel as if too many drugs will cause a stroke for me as well - one just can't win can one!!! Keep well and best of luck. Ros.
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: That's funny because I was getting dreadful joint pain on Arimidex but it was much worse in the nights and when I tried to get up in the mornings - was like an old woman 200 years old, but once I got up and mobile and went straight onto the health walker for a good 10 minutes to get the knees and hips mobile I seemed to come a lot better. I read that while sleeping the blood stays in one place and this is what is causing the dreadful cramps and pains, but once you are mobile the blood starts flowing again to help the problem. I need to set my alarm for an hour at a time then walk around the bedroom for a few minutes then back to bed - lol! Oh well I am now trying Aromasin to see how I get on. I also try to avoid pain killers as my Mother had a stroke at quite an early stage. Keep well regards Roz.
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: For explaining the whole picture to me regarding the AIs. I started taking Aromasin yesterday, I realise that I am still going to get side effects but can but try something different just to see how it goes. The nights can't be any worse than they were while taking Arimidex - can they???? I sometimes wonder if I should just stop but the thought of getting breast cancer again scares the hell out of me. I'll report back in about 3 months to let you know how I am getting on. Regards Roz x
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: I had a mastectomy 2 years ago this week, had a reconstruction a year later. I found another lump - big one actually - in the other breast about 6 weeks ago, I immediately thought the worst. I went in straight away for a mammogram and sonar, I was so scared. It was just a big cyst which they aspirated, I was so relieved. I am not sure if you have the lump in the side of the breast removal or the remaining breast, but either way I would get it checked out as soon as possible. I hope everything works out well. Regards Roz.
Posts.Title: Has This Happened to Anyone Else

Posts.Content: Hi Lori I posted a message on 14/9 regarding Arimidex and Aromasin, I think you must be taking Arimidex with your new prescripion. There are 3 amomatase inhibitors, which are Aromasin, Femara and Arimidex. I am so mixed up as my oncologist has just started me on Aromasin to see if the side effects aren't so bad as on Arimidex, which I have been on for about 20 months. I've had quite a few replies from my messages, it might be worth you reading them as it may be a help. I'm trying to keep off painkillers as I feel that they could cause a stroke and my Mother died from a stroke at quite an early age. Go well and good luck. Ros.
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: Hi Christine Sorry to hear you are having pains with Aromasin. I have posted a message on 14/9 which you might be interested in as I had quite a few replies from it. I think all 3 aromatase inhibitors - Arimidex, Femara and Aromasin - all seem to have side effects with most people. I start taking Aromasin as from October as I just cannot take the pains in the joints any more with Arimidex, I started off alright and only started getting pains after about 6 months of being on the drug but 20 months later I have been in excrutiating pain and could hardly get out of bed. I can't bear the thought of having the same pains with Aromasin. I will, nevertheless, take it for a while to see how I get on. I will write a message in a few months time letting everyone know how I am getting on. I think all these oncologists/physicians etc., do not realise how painful the side effects are on this medication - perhaps the trials have not been for long enough. Go well and good luck. Ros.
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: No, I don't intend stopping the medication unless the side effects get so bad that my quality of life has gone, I will persevere as long as I can. Thanks so much for the info on the fish oils and flax seed oil, I am going to go and get some flax seed oil this weekend, I am very impressed. I have changed my diet since getting breast cancer especially since reading Prof Jane Plant's book "Your Life in Your Hands" well worth a read and makes you sit up and think! I've cut out most dairy products now, rice milk powder is so much tastier than milk as well. Best wishes Roz.
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: Hi there I have only just come across your message regarding your Mother. I had a mastectomy in November 2003, I had no choice, I had a 2nd opinion just in case but both surgeons agreed, I also had 15 lymph nodes removed, non of them cancerous. I must admit I got more pain from the armpit than having the actual breast taken off. I went for a reconstruction this year and am coming along very well. I am glad I had the mastectomy as they said the cancer was positioned in such a way they had to take away most of the tissue etc. A friend of mine had a lumpectomy around the time I had the mastectomy, she is also coming along nicely, so either way I think it is a decision your Mum must make. I don't think either way is the BEST option, it is the preference of the individual. I joined a cancer group in Johannesburg called Bosom Buddies and every lady has a different story to tell. Some opted for a double mastectomy for their own reasons, some opted for lumpectomies and others mastectomies. What shines through all of the meetings is though, that everyone was very much alive and seemed to have come through the ordeals with optimism, strength and a sense of humour. Good luck to your Mother and I hope she recovers quickly. Regards Ros.
Posts.Title: Help For my Mother

Posts.Content: a recon or both from an op done a long time ago? I had a mastectomy November 2003 then a chest expander recon which started in August 2004 and finished January 2005. I am now getting a very bad ache in the muscles of the upper arm, across the back of the side of my neck and across the chest and under the armpit. It is a nagging ache continually and it is really getting me down. I don't know if I am being a wimp or if there is something perhaps trapped from one of the operations. I do not know if I should go back to the surgeon who did the reconstruction. I get better days than others, today all I want to do is lie down to take the pressure off the arm and chest. I am not ill and not tired so it is so annoying to go and lie down just to rest the areas with a heat pad. I really hope that someone can relate to this and try to help me. Thanks Love Roz xx
Posts.Title: is Anyone Suffering Pain From a Mastectomy or

Posts.Content: I've been taking Aromasin now for just about a year. I was on Arimidex for 2 years and had to come off it as I had dreadful side effects with painful hip and knee joints. At first I thought Aromasin was great, now the pain is starting in the ankles. Early morning I can hardly move my feet, it does ease up as the day goes on but I wonder if it is going to get worse. I remember reading on this forum that someone was having problems with their feet due to Aromasin...not sure where it was though. Roz xx
Posts.Title: Does Anyone Get Painful Ankles and Feel While on Aromasin?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I have been taking Arimidex for about 2 years and have been getting such bad side effects of joint and bone pains that the oncologist has taken me off it and is putting me on Aromasin. He said that they are all aromatase inhibitors therefore I could get side effects from this medication also. I just wondered if there was anyone out there who has been on Aromasin for a while and if they are experiencing side effects from it. I have to try something as the pains were worsening by the day and I was feeling that I was aging far too quickly! I do hope that there is someone out there that can help me on this one. Regards Ros.
Posts.Title: Has Anyone Been on Aromasin and Are They Getting Side Effects?

Posts.Content: Hi Mary You have lasted longer than I have on Arimidex so I take my hat off to you! I have been on Arimidex for about 20 months and didn't really experience any side effects until a few months ago, although did have a bad back but then I have always been prone to aches in the lower back. Then a few months ago I found I was getting severe pains in the hips, moreso in the right hip, also in the knees and down the bones of the upper leg. I got these pains mostly at night and started finding it difficult to sleep long before being woken up with the pain. Not every night though, some nights were far worse than others, some nights the knees would be painful and sometimes the hips, or both. It started to wear me down as I began to be tired all the time - and depressed. But the tiredness and depression could be because I lacked proper sleep. I had read all about Arimidex on the internet and know that it has come out best with all the clinical trials so I know I am on a good aromatase inhibitor for lowering the estrogen levels, but if I am getting steadily worse and am losing my quality of life then I am prepared to try something else. I have been an avid reader of these messages on this notice board and see that a few ladies have changed to Aromasin and I wanted to know if they were experiencing side effects. I inquired with the oncologist about changing. He was all for it, he said I mustn't carry on in such pain so I am going to start taking it as from October. He said I may have as many side effects as I am getting with Arimidex but I am prepared to take my chances. There is also another aromatase inhibitor called Femara that a lot of people are on and I mentioned this also to my oncologist but he seemed keen for me to try Aromasin. He also said that perhaps it was the aging process creeping up on me....I told him I was prepared for it but not this quickly! I am only 57 - a spring chicken as far as I am concerned! Every day I seem to get worse and notice a change so goodness knows how I will be after 5 years on Arimidex! I know aging does not creep on you THIS FAST! I am staying positive though and will try anything and do not want to stop taking something as I feel it is keeping the cancer away. I hope this has been of some help for you Mary and I would be grateful if you will let me know the outcome of your visit to the oncologist in October. Keep well Ros.
Posts.Title: Has Anyone Been on Aromasin and Are They Getting Side Effects?

Posts.Content: Hi Bobbie Thanks for replying regarding the side effects of Arimidex. I cannot believe that AstraZeneca cannot give you answers to your questions. If we are taking the drugs then they should have the common decency to let us know what is going to happen to our bodies. If I may ask you, whereabouts do you live? I am also going to write to the newspapers and ladies magazines here to let them know what is going on. It is, ironically, Breast Cancer Awareness month in October so a good month to get a debate going in the ladies magazines over here. I am in Johannesburg SA and know of an organisation called Bosom Buddies so will let them know about this to see if they will push it forward. I also didn't realise that an increase in cholesterol was another side effect - mine was already high before I started taking Arimidex, no one, not even my oncologist took my cholesterol levels to see how high they were. Quite scary really isn't it? But I still take it because I am scared not to take it. Keep well and good luck. Ros.
Posts.Title: Has Anyone Been on Aromasin and Are They Getting Side Effects?

Posts.Content: Hi Bobbie Thanks for the email address, and nice to know where you are living. I would be grateful if you let me know how you get on with the rely to your letter to AstraZeneca. I am going to write to our popular ladies' mag over here to see if they follow anything up. I am going to print and copy a lot of the letters on the cancercompass website and send them in to show them how many people are suffering from bad side effects. If it is worldwide then maybe they will do something about it. I don't think our oncologists and physicians realize just how bad the side effects can be. I don't suppose you could send me the website address of the cancer site in UK, I have been through the whole of the website and can't come up with anything other than this website - which I think is great - and breastcancer.org which I don't rate much. I am originally from UK but have lived in SA for 23 years so it would be interesting to hear some of the ladies views from UK. I am not suffering from night sweats though, only bad joint pains, but I may need the products' names you say are great for sweats when I start next month on Aromasin! Go well and good luck with AstraZeneca. Regards Roz.
Posts.Title: Has Anyone Been on Aromasin and Are They Getting Side Effects?

Posts.Content: Hi Jane Thanks for the information which has left me wondering if it is going to do me any good. I don't think I have much to lose though as the pains were so bad on Arimidex - how bad can it get? Sorry to hear that your cancer came back when taking Tamoxifen. My oncologist said he only puts people on aromatase inhibitors when they have gone through menopause (I had a full hysterectomy 10 years ago), so perhaps you are right and that is why they aren't working fully for you. Thank you for taking the time to reply to me. Regards Ros.
Posts.Title: Has Anyone Been on Aromasin and Are They Getting Side Effects?

Posts.Content: Haven't been on this site for a while and noticed your message so you are up and running again, thank goodness. I will go on the uk website to see what you have to say! Nice to see you are back anyway, I've missed you. I started taking Aromasin yesterday - after 2 years on Arimidex - maybe I am getting paranoid but could have sworn I felt sick all day! Actually had a better nights sleep without too much joint pain either - I am keeping fingers crossed (or thumbs as they say in this country). Lovely to have you back. Love Roz x
Posts.Title: Has Anyone Been on Aromasin and Are They Getting Side Effects?

Posts.Content: Hi Linda, Thanks for replying to my message and you have given me hope at least. I didn't know about the chemical make up of the drugs so that was interesting to hear. I actually didn't have any side effects from Arimidex for about 6 months though so maybe I will still get them. But it is worth trying something different in case it really does work for me. I am noticing that a lot of ladies who do not experience pain from the drugs actually say that the cancer has reoccurred so it seems that the more pain we endure then the cancer won't come back! I don't mind putting up with discomfort but to get excrutiating pain so no joke. I also think that your quality of life is very important and watching yourself go 'downhill' so quickly is certainly no joke. I'd be so grateful if you can let me know how you are doing from time to time and when I am on Aromasin as from the beginning of October I will let you know how I am doing too. Go well. Regards Ros.
Posts.Title: Has Anyone Been on Aromasin and Are They Getting Side Effects?

Posts.Content: Hi Bobbie Thanks for the UK cancer website, it seems quite good. It's worth asking about Aromasin and Arimidex anyway. Go well. Ros.
Posts.Title: Has Anyone Been on Aromasin and Are They Getting Side Effects?
